slides.title: Welcome to CIMA BA2
slides.content:
# BA2 - Fundamentals of Management Accounting

BA2 covers **costing and budgeting** fundamentals.

## What You Will Learn

- **Cost Classification** - Types of costs
- **Costing Methods** - Job, process
- **Budgeting** - Planning and control
- **Standard Costing** - Variances

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Cost identification | 25% |
| Costing methods | 25% |
| Budgeting | 25% |
| Standard costing | 25% |

slides.title: Cost Classification
slides.content:
# Types of Costs

## By Behavior

| Type | Pattern |
|------|--------|
| Fixed | Constant total |
| Variable | Per unit constant |
| Semi-variable | Both components |
| Step | Fixed in ranges |

## By Nature

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Materials | Raw items |
| Labor | Wages |
| Overheads | Indirect costs |

## By Function

- Production
- Administration
- Selling and distribution

slides.title: Cost Behavior
slides.content:
# Understanding Cost Patterns

## High-Low Method

```
Variable Cost = (High Cost - Low Cost) / (High Units - Low Units)

Fixed Cost = Total Cost - (Variable x Units)
```

## Total Cost Formula

```
Total Cost = Fixed Cost + (Variable Cost x Units)
```

## Relevant Range

```
Range where assumptions hold
Outside range, costs may change
```

slides.title: Cost Elements
slides.content:
# Product Cost Build-Up

## Cost Structure

```
Direct Materials
+ Direct Labor
= Prime Cost

Prime Cost
+ Production Overhead
= Production Cost

Production Cost
+ Non-production Overhead
= Total Cost
```

## Direct vs Indirect

| Direct | Indirect |
|--------|----------|
| Traceable to product | Cannot trace |
| Variable usually | Fixed usually |

slides.title: Overhead Absorption
slides.content:
# Allocating Overheads

## Absorption Rate

```
OAR = Budgeted Overhead / Budgeted Activity
```

## Absorption Bases

| Base | When Used |
|------|----------|
| Direct labor hours | Labor intensive |
| Machine hours | Capital intensive |
| Units | Homogeneous products |

## Over/Under Absorption

```
Absorbed - Actual = Difference

Positive = Over-absorbed (credit)
Negative = Under-absorbed (debit)
```

slides.title: Job Costing
slides.content:
# Job Order Costing

## When Used

- Custom products
- Unique orders
- Identifiable jobs

## Job Cost Card

```
Materials issued
+ Labor charged
+ Overhead absorbed
= Total job cost
```

## Batch Costing

```
Total batch cost / Number of units
= Cost per unit
```

slides.title: Costing Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Prime cost equals direct materials plus?

slides.title: Process Costing
slides.content:
# Continuous Production

## When Used

- Mass production
- Homogeneous products
- Continuous processing

## Equivalent Units

```
Complete units + (WIP x % complete)
= Equivalent units
```

## Cost per EU

```
Total costs / Equivalent units
= Cost per equivalent unit
```

## Normal Loss

```
Expected wastage
No cost allocated
```

slides.title: Budgeting Basics
slides.content:
# Budget Preparation

## Budget Purpose

| Purpose | Benefit |
|---------|--------|
| Planning | Future direction |
| Coordination | Align activities |
| Control | Performance measure |
| Motivation | Targets |

## Master Budget

```
Sales Budget (starting point)
    |
    v
Production Budget
    |
    v
Cost Budgets
    |
    v
Cash Budget
    |
    v
Master Budget
```

slides.title: Cash Budgeting
slides.content:
# Cash Flow Planning

## Structure

```
Opening balance
+ Receipts
- Payments
= Closing balance
```

## Collection Pattern

```
Month of sale: 40%
One month later: 40%
Two months later: 18%
Bad debts: 2%
```

## Working Capital Impact

- Receivables timing
- Payables timing
- Inventory levels

slides.title: Flexible Budgets
slides.content:
# Flexing the Budget

## Static vs Flexible

| Static | Flexible |
|--------|----------|
| One level | Multiple levels |
| Original plan | Adjusted |

## Flexing Formula

```
Flexed Budget = Fixed Costs + (Variable Rate x Actual Volume)
```

## Purpose

- Fair comparison
- Volume impact removed
- True efficiency measured

slides.title: Standard Costing
slides.content:
# Standards and Variances

## Standard Cost

```
Predetermined cost
Based on expected performance
```

## Basic Variances

| Variance | Formula |
|----------|--------|
| Price | (Actual - Standard) x Actual Qty |
| Usage | (Actual - Standard Qty) x Std Price |

## Favorable vs Adverse

| F | A |
|---|---|
| Better than standard | Worse than standard |

slides.title: Variance Analysis
slides.content:
# Material and Labor

## Material Variances

```
Price: (AP - SP) x AQ
Usage: (AQ - SQ) x SP
```

## Labor Variances

```
Rate: (AR - SR) x AH
Efficiency: (AH - SH) x SR
```

## Interpretation

| Variance | Possible Cause |
|----------|---------------|
| Price (+) | Good purchasing |
| Usage (-) | Material waste |
| Rate (-) | Higher wages |
| Efficiency (+) | Skilled workers |
